Notes: Schools are open and students are given the option of wearing a mask or not.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/http://coronavirus.bernews.com/some-covid-restrictions-in-schools-relaxed/*

No change. Regular testing, hygiene practices, social distancing when appropriate, use of face masks and PPE.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.gov.bm/workplace-quarantine-immunised-workers*
Public events can hold. However, masks to be worn with social distancing.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://bm.usconsulate.gov/covid-19-information/*

â¢ Indoor and outdoor dining is permitted. However, restaurants, bars, night clubs, and sports or members clubs are required to limit tables to no more than ten customers. Bar service will be permitted, but customers must remain seated. No standing at the bar â¢ Face coverings are required to be worn indoors (unless eating or drinking), and must be worn in crowded outdoor settings, as well as where a six feet physical distance cannot be maintained. â¢ Gatherings are restricted to groups of no more than 50 people.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bermuda/coronavirus*
Masks to be worn and social distancing from other passengers recommended if possible.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://bm.usconsulate.gov/covid-19-information/*
All curfew has been lifted on February 28, 2022.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://web.archive.org/web/20220308002254/https://www.gov.bm/coronavirus-recreation*
No restrictions on internal movement.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://bm.usconsulate.gov/covid-19-information/*
Same policies still in place.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://bm.usconsulate.gov/covid-19-information/*

On 25 april 2022, some jurisdictions have no covid-related health measures in schools. However, some provinces and territories continue to require masks and other covid-related health measures in schools â e.g., some Atlantic provinces and Quebec. Some post-secondary institutions throughout Canada are offering classes and exams online or have implemented vaccine mandates for students and staff to enter campus. In most cases, these decisions are set by individual post-secondary institutions rather than dictated or guided by governments. E.g., âOntarioâs top doctor said â¦ that vaccine policies at post-secondary institutions have served their purpose and should be dropped, saying their removal should align with the [1 March] end of the provinceâs vaccine certificate system. But several Ontario universities said they are keeping their vaccination policies in effect.â At Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN), Newfoundland and Labradorâs (NLâs) only university and largest post-secondary institution: âStudents, staff and faculty at Memorial must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved accommodation. This requirement aligns with the Government of Newfoundland and Labradorâs Mandatory Vaccination Policy and is subject to change based on changes to the government policy.â In sum, 1T fits vaccinated students with mask and other covid-related health measures still applicable in schools in some jurisdictions and 2T fits for unvaccinated students, who cannot enter the post-secondary MUN campus because MUN âaligns with the Government of Newfoundland and Labradorâs Mandatory Vaccination Policyâ. See government of PEI, MUN, Globe and Mail, Montreal Gazette, CBC , CITY, and Global news websites, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220425141740/https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/information/health-and-wellness/moving-on-transition-plan-to-living-with-covid-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20220416132956/https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/information/health-and-wellness/chief-public-health-office-back-to-school-guidance-march-2022  https://web.archive.org/web/20220425185146/https://www.gov.nl.ca/covid-19/schools-children/schools/masks/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220416133316/https://globalnews.ca/news/8740373/covid-montreal-schools-mask-use/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220416133507/https://montrealgazette.com/news/local-news/covid-19-updates-montreal-quebec-new-cases-hospital-vaccine-booster-dose-mask-sixth-wave-easter-passover-gathering-drouin-april-14  https://web.archive.org/web/20220425190207/https://www.mun.ca/covid19/news.php?id=14864&type=news  https://web.archive.org/web/20220223150318/https://toronto.citynews.ca/2022/02/22/ontario-universities-covid19-masks-restrictions/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220310123253/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-ontario-lifting-covid-19-mask-mandates-in-most-public-settings/

On 16 may 2022, the government of Canada continues ârequiring full vaccination for Canadians boarding a commercial plane or train for travel to domestic and international destinationsâ. A prominent professor of medicine urges the government to âreconsider [as] The justification behind vaccine mandates is that they help prevent transmission. But this does not seem to be the case any longer, with the Omicron variantâ. He cites equity grounds and several other arguments against the national governmentâs vaccine mandate for domestic air and rail travelers. See Globe and Mail newspaper, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220514162340/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/opinion/article-the-logic-behind-vaccine-mandates-for-travellers-no-longer-holds/

On 23 may 2022, the government of Canada âcontinues to ban unvaccinated people from domestic plane and train travelâ. The editorial board of a leading newspaper argues that the government âneeds to explain whyâ. See Government of Canada as well as Globe and Mail newspaper websites, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220519151106/https://travel.gc.ca/travel-covid/travel-restrictions/domestic-travel  https://web.archive.org/web/20220521155247/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/opinion/editorials/article-is-it-time-to-end-canadas-last-remaining-covid-travel-restrictions/

On 25 april 2022: âTravellers are eligible to enter or return to Canada if they qualify as a fully vaccinated travellerâ¦at least 2 doses of a vaccine accepted for travel, a mix of 2 accepted vaccines or at least 1 dose of the Janssen/Johnson & Johnson vaccine; have received your second dose at least 14 calendar days before you enter Canada; have no signs or symptoms of COVID-19; â¦ You must use the ArriveCAN mobile app or sign in on a computer to enter your proof of vaccination, quarantine and travel informationâ¦Upon your entry to Canada by air or at a land border crossing, the border services officer may notify you that youâve been randomly selected for a mandatory arrival test. As a fully vaccinated traveller, you can travel to your destination, including on connecting flights, without waiting for your arrival test results (if selected for testing)...Fully vaccinated travellers arriving from any country arenât required to quarantine while awaiting their test result, if youâre randomly selected for a mandatory arrival test.â In sum, the Canadian border is closed to all unvaccinated, non-essential foreign visitors and open to fully vaccinated foreign visitors subject to screening requirements. See Government of Canada website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220425145354/https://travel.gc.ca/travel-covid/travel-restrictions/covid-vaccinated-travellers-entering-canada

On 2 may 2022: âTravellers are eligible to enter or return to Canada if they qualify as a fully vaccinated travellerâ¦at least 2 doses of a vaccine accepted for travel, a mix of 2 accepted vaccines or at least 1 dose of the Janssen/Johnson & Johnson vaccine; have received your second dose at least 14 calendar days before you enter Canada; have no signs or symptoms of COVID-19; â¦ You must use the ArriveCAN mobile app or sign in on a computer to enter your proof of vaccination, quarantine and travel informationâ¦Upon your entry to Canada by air or at a land border crossing, the border services officer may notify you that youâve been randomly selected for a mandatory arrival test. As a fully vaccinated traveller, you can travel to your destination, including on connecting flights, without waiting for your arrival test results (if selected for testing)...Fully vaccinated travellers arriving from any country arenât required to quarantine while awaiting their test result, if youâre randomly selected for a mandatory arrival test.â In sum, the Canadian border is closed to unvaccinated, non-essential foreign visitors and open to fully vaccinated foreign visitors subject to screening requirements. On 25 april 2022, the policy intent of some jurisdictions continues to be to supplement polymerase chain reaction (PCR) testing of symptomatic cases with mass availability of lateral flow and other rapid tests to asymptomatic individuals. However, in most parts of Canada, the caseload wave is frustrating efforts to achieve testing aspirations. One of Canadaâs top health policy journalists sums up the current situation: âwe have now severely restricted PCR testing and we donât make any effort to collect data on rapid testingâ. See Government of Canada as well as Globe and Mail newspaper websites, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220425173100/https://www.canada.ca/en/public-health/services/diseases/2019-novel-coronavirus-infection/symptoms/testing.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220425180706/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/opinion/article-reinfections-are-the-latest-covid-19-curveball/

On 25 april 2022, government of Canada advises that when individuals âtest positive for COVID-19, a public health official will ask you questions to collect important information about your symptoms; activities and travel you did before you tested positive; all the people you may have been in close contact with while you were contagious ...contact tracing. It's a key public health measure.â Most provinces and territories intend to follow this practice, if conditions and resources permit. However, tracing capacity is not sufficient in most jurisdictions to deal with high case numbers. In most cases, contact tracing responsibility is up to individuals who are symptomatic and/or have tested positive. In Canadaâs most populous province, Ontario: âIf you have symptoms of COVID-19 or have tested positive, tell your close contacts that they have been exposedâ¦ Informing your contact will help stop the spread of the virus. Give them the link to this webpage, ontario.ca/exposed, so they can protect themselves and their contacts.â See Governments of Canada and Ontario websites, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220425173100/https://www.canada.ca/en/public-health/services/diseases/2019-novel-coronavirus-infection/symptoms/testing.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220425155331/https://covid-19.ontario.ca/exposed

On 25 april 2022  10:51AM EDT, according to the CTV news unofficial vaccine tracker, 32,756,305 Canadians (86% of the total national population and 90% of the vaccine-eligible population aged 5+) have received at least one dose of an approved COVID-19 vaccine -- Moderna, Pfizer, Johnson & Johnson (J&J) Janssen, or AstraZeneca (no longer recommended except in limited circumstances) and with Novavax and Medicago Cofifenz recently approved. 31,245,021 Canadians (82% of total pop. and 86% of vax-eligible aged 5+) have received two doses. All provinces and territories are making vaccinations available to residents aged 5 and up. Provinces and territories are also delivering third doses. 18,357,274 third doses have been administered accounting for 48% of the national population. Provinces and territories have started delivering fourth doses in some circumstances. (Note that vaccination data may not include Canadians who returned home after being vaccinated in other countries while wintering at retirement homes or on essential work trips. On the other hand, there may be a small amount of double-counting when residents live and work in different provinces, vaccinations took place at work, and both provinces count the vaccinations.) âFree vaccines will be available to everyone in Canada.â See government of Canada website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220424153826/https://health-infobase.canada.ca/covid-19/vaccination-coverage/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220424224405/https://www.canada.ca/en/public-health/services/diseases/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/vaccines.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220410183243/https://www.canada.ca/content/dam/phac-aspc/documents/services/immunization/national-advisory-committee-on-immunization-naci/naci-summary-april-5-2022.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20220424222620/https://www.canada.ca/content/dam/phac-aspc/documents/services/immunization/national-advisory-committee-on-immunization-naci/naci-summary-april-12-2022.pdf

On 25 april 2022, in Newfoundland and Labrador (NL): âTemporary restrictions to visitation/attendance are in place at all provincially operated acute care facilities, treatment facilities, health centres and long-term care homes; as well as privately operated long-term care homes, personal care homes, and community care homesâ¦ Each patient/resident can have up to two visitors at a timeâ.
